00022 const GateEvaluate g_EvaluateTable[] = 
00023 {
00024     And,
00025     Or,
00026     Not,
00027     Nand,
00028     Nor,
00029     Xor,
00030     Buf
00031 };
00032

00035     
00036 /*
00037  * Gate Evaluation  
00038  * We use a table of function pointers.
00039  * The appropriate function is invoked by indexing 
00040  * into the table using the gatetype field of the calling
00041  * gate object
00042  */
00043 
00044 Value Gate::Evaluate()
00045 {
00046     return g_EvaluateTable[gtype](inputs);
00047 }

00053 /*
00054  * The logic functions
00055  * AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR
00056  */
00057 Value And(list<Wire*> inputs)
00058 {
00059    int output=ONE;      
00060    list<Wire*>::iterator iter;
00061    
00062    for (iter=inputs.begin(); iter != inputs.end(); iter++ )
00063    {
00064        output &= (*iter)->value;
00065    }
00066    return (Value)output;
00067 
00068 }

00072 Value Or(list<Wire*> inputs)
00073 {
00074     int  output=ZERO;   
00075     list<Wire*>::iterator iter;
00076 
00077     for (iter=inputs.begin(); iter != inputs.end(); iter++ )
00078     {
00079            output |= (*iter)->value;
00080     }
00081     return (Value)output;
00082 
00083 }

00087 Value Buf(list<Wire*> inputs)
00088 {
00089    Value output=U;
00090    list<Wire*>::iterator iter;
00091    assert(inputs.size() == 1);
00092 
00093    for (iter=inputs.begin(); iter != inputs.end(); iter++ )
00094     {
00095            output = (*iter)->value;
00096     }
00097     return output;
00098 }

00102 
00103 Value Not(list<Wire*> inputs)
00104 {
00105    Value output=U;
00106    list<Wire*>::iterator iter;
00107    assert(inputs.size() == 1);
00108    
00109    iter=inputs.begin();
00110    output = (Value) ((*iter)->value != U)?(Value)(~((*iter)->value)&0xf):U;
00111     
00112    return output;
00113 }

00122 Value Nand(list<Wire*> inputs)
00123 {
00124     int output=ZERO;
00125     list<Wire *>::iterator iter;
00126     Value curValue;
00127 
00128     // Use DeMorgan's laws. They help maintain accuracy here
00129     // since the negation in the end loses the Value information
00130 
00131     EVALUATE_DFILE << "Nand Evaluate called "  << endl;
00132     for (iter=inputs.begin(); iter != inputs.end(); iter++ )
00133     {    
00134         EVALUATE_DFILE << "Input wire is  " << (*iter)->id << " with value  " << (*iter)->value << endl; 
00135         curValue = (Value) ((*iter)->value != U)?(Value)(~((*iter)->value)&0xf):U;
00136 
00137         output |= curValue;
00138     }
00139     EVALUATE_DFILE << "Output is "  <<  (Value) output << endl;
00140     EVALUATE_DFILE << endl << endl;
00141     return (Value) output; 
00142 }
00143 
00144 
00145 Value Nor(list<Wire*> inputs)
00146 {
00147    int output=ONE;
00148    list<Wire *>::iterator iter;
00149    Value curValue;
00150    
00151    
00152    
00153    // Use DeMorgan's laws. They help maintain accuracy here
00154    // since the negation in the end loses the Value information
00155    
00156    for (iter=inputs.begin(); iter != inputs.end(); iter++ )
00157    {    
00158            curValue = (Value) ((*iter)->value != U)?(Value)(~((*iter)->value)&0xf):U;
00159        output &= curValue;
00160    }
00161    
00162    
00163    return (Value)(output);
00164 
00165 }
00166 
00167 
00168 Value Xor(list<Wire *> inputs)
00169 {
00170     int output=ZERO;
00171     list<Wire *>::iterator iter;
00172     Value curOutput;
00173     Value curNegOutput;
00174     Value curValue;
00175     Value curNegValue;
00176 
00177 
00178     for (iter=inputs.begin(); iter != inputs.end(); iter++)
00179     {
00180 
00181 
00182             curValue = (*iter)->value;   
00183             curNegValue = (Value) ((*iter)->value != U)?(Value)(~((*iter)->value)&0xf):U;
00184         curOutput = (Value)output;
00185         curNegOutput =(output != U)?(Value)(~output&0xf):U;
00186 
00187         output = ((output & curNegValue) | (curNegOutput & curValue));
00188     }
00189     return (Value)output;
00190 }

00193 bool Evaluate( Circuit& circuit)
00194 {
00195     int level=1;
00196     multimap<int,Element*>:: iterator levelIter;
00197     map<string,Wire*> ::iterator iter =  (circuit.PriInputs).begin();
00198 
00199     CIRCUIT_DFILE << "Circuit evaluation called for" << endl;
00200 
00201     // first propage the values on primary inputs to the immediate brances
00202     for ( iter = (circuit.PriInputs).begin(); iter != (circuit.PriInputs).end(); iter++)
00203     {
00204         Wire *outputWire = (iter->second);
00205         Value curValue = outputWire->value;
00206                 if  ((outputWire->outputs).size() > 1) 
00207                 {
00208                     list<Element*>::iterator iterator = (outputWire->outputs).begin();
00209                     CIRCUIT_DFILE << "Evaluating stemouts of wire " << outputWire->id << endl;
00210                     /* Reasons for the dynamic cast: 
00211                      * If the output wire has > 1 output, they are all bound to
00212                      * be wires.
00213                      * */
00214                     for (;iterator != (outputWire->outputs).end(); iterator++)
00215                     {
00216                         //cout << "output: " << (*iterator)->id << endl;
00217                         Wire* check = (dynamic_cast<Wire*>(*iterator));
00218                         assert(check);
00219                         CIRCUIT_DFILE << "Setting value of branch " <<  check->id <<   " of wire " << outputWire->id << " to "  << (int) curValue << endl;
00220                         // if the value of the wire is already set, don't set it again. (might be becuase it is faulty)
00221                         if (check->value == U)
00222                             check->value = curValue;
00223 
00224                     }
00225 
00226                 }
00227     }
00228 
00229     do
00230     {
00231         /* first and second are the end-point iterators that has been
00232          * returned on qeurying the multimap on a value
00233          */
00234         for (levelIter = ((circuit.Levels).equal_range(level)).first; 
00235                 levelIter !=((circuit.Levels).equal_range(level)).second; levelIter++)
00236         {
00237             //   cout <<"Iter is now at" << levelIter->second->id  <<endl;
00238             if ( (levelIter->second)->type == GATE)
00239             {
00240                 Gate* curGate = dynamic_cast<Gate*>(levelIter->second);
00241                 Value curValue = curGate->Evaluate();
00242                 Wire* outputWire = curGate->output;
00243                 CIRCUIT_DFILE << "Setting value of wire " << outputWire->id << " to " << (int)curValue << endl; 
00244                 // if the value of the wire is already set, don't set it again. (might be becuase it is faulty)
00245                 if (outputWire->value == U)
00246                     outputWire->value = curValue;
00247 
00248                 if  ((outputWire->outputs).size() > 1) 
00249                 {
00250                     list<Element*>::iterator iter = (outputWire->outputs).begin();
00251                     CIRCUIT_DFILE << "Evaluating stemouts of wire " << outputWire->id << endl;
00252                     /* Reasons for the dynamic cast: 
00253                      * If the output wire has > 1 output, they are all bound to
00254                      * be wires.
00255                      * */
00256                     for (;iter != (outputWire->outputs).end(); iter++)
00257                     {
00258                         //cout << "output: " << (*iter)->id << endl;
00259                         Wire* check = (dynamic_cast<Wire*>(*iter));
00260                         assert(check);
00261                         CIRCUIT_DFILE << "Setting value of branch " <<  check->id <<   " of wire " << outputWire->id << " to "  << (int) curValue << endl;
00262                         // if the value of the wire is already set, don't set it again. (might be becuase it is faulty)
00263                         if (check->value == U)
00264                             check->value = curValue;
00265 
00266                     }
00267 
00268                 }
00269 
00270             }
00271             else cout << "something wrong" << endl;
00272 
00273 
00274         }
00275     }while (   (circuit.Levels).find(++level) != (circuit.Levels).end() ); 
00276 
00277     iter = (circuit.PriOutputs).begin();
00278     
00279 //    for (;iter != (circuit.PriOutputs).end(); iter++)
00280 //    {   
00281 //         cout << "PO: " << (iter->second)->id << "value:  " << (iter->second)->value << endl;
00282 //    }
00283 
00284     return true;
00285 }
